page.title: 032058 BRUNSTANE
page.content: { {LANDSCAPE: FARMLAND}is the primary land cover.Approximately 50%of the area is grassland in almost equal proportions of intensively managed grassland and enclosed rough grazing { {WOODLAND}is the secondary cover accounting for about a 25% of the area.3/4 of the trees are dominantly deciduous,1/4 is a plantation of conifers.There is also a field sown with turnips and potatoes.{INLAND {WATER}The N.Esk meanders from S.W.to E.between steep banks.Cornton Burn crosses the N.of the area.{RESIDENTIAL The buildings consisted of a farmhouse with steading and two cottages.{ {DERELICT LAND}The remains of a ruined sixteenth century castle built at a vantage point on the steep bank on the N.side of the River Esk.
